Articles.Content:
I dunno if this is the right place for this, it is more a suggestion of a minor tweak than a whole new concept or idea. . . but anyway:

The parts I am thinking of are the following:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Aerodynamic_Nose_Cone

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Standard_NC

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Sensor_Array_Computing_Nose_Cone

They mass

0.03, 0.1 and 0.08 respectively which I would suggest makes no sense.

The Aerodynamic Nose Cone is the largest and masses the least.

The Standard Nose Cone and Sensor Array Computing Nose Cone are identical in term of size and presumably the Sensor version has more "stuff" in it and yet the standard masses more.

I'd suggest perhaps:

Aerodynamic Nose Cone: 0.05 - 0.1

Standard Nose Cone: 0.01 - 0.03

Sensor Array Computing Nose Cone: 0.1 - 0.2 (it after all is more than just a hollow shell)

all aerodynamic parts are set to be reworked, along with the aerodynamics update. nose dunes are currently a wast of mass, and apart from a slight (i repeat: SLIGHT) increase in stability, they serve no purpose other than wights for balancing.
I wish the nose cones had fuel or some kind of senor or even a chute built in (while still looking pointy), at least until better aerodynamics are put in.
Parachute/nosecone combos, now that's a good idea.

Must admit I usually use them aesthetically . . . which is why the mass thing is annoying.

I don't want to add a ton to my craft just to make it look nicer!
Edit the .cfg files, or just deal with it. Besides, 80 kg is not that much, especially not because you are mostly adding cones to boosters which are dropped during ascent.
